text:
join me in a cocktail Sawaddee ka welcome to hot 
thai kitchen in the previous episode I showed

you how to infuse Thai herbs into your alcohol 
and in this episode we're gonna take our infused

alcohol and make a cocktail which I've decided to 
call the htk now the htk is basically kaffir lime

infused vodka with mango juice and then spiced 
with some Thai chili vodka and then I'm going to

show you a variation that you can make that's 
even more delicious so this cocktail involves

mango juice now you could use store-bought mango 
juice if it's good quality pure mango juice but

I can't really find that here so I'm going to 
make my own so show you how you can make that

so let's start with that first let's take a look 
at our ingredients 175 grams of mango you can

use fresh or frozen I'm using frozen because 
this time of year there is no fresh mango half

a cup of water 3 to 4 tablespoons of sugar 2 
to 3 tablespoons of lime juice and so we're

basically going to mix everything together and 
you can use any kind of blender you like now I'm

adding sugar and lime juice and I'm giving you 
a rough estimate of how much to use but that's

really going to depend on how sweet and sour your 
mango is which can vary quite a lot depending on

the brand I'm using this one that comes from the 
Philippines and it's actually really sweet and

not sour at all so you may need slightly more 
slightly less so just gonna blend it all up

okay so that looks good now you what you want 
to do is taste it especially if this is your

first time doing it and what you're tasting for 
is first consistency you don't want it to be too

thick that's why I added water because you don't 
want it to make your cocktail viscous that's not

nice and you also want it to taste good enough 
that you would drink it on its own that's kind

of the thing to go for that's good you want it to 
be on a sweet side though because it is getting

diluted a little bit so it should taste like a 
sweet good mango juice so now that we have our

freshly made mango juice we're gonna start making 
the cocktail disclaimer I am a chef and not a

bartender so if you have great bartending tips 
please send it off KACE first we're gonna start

with our Oh chill out our glass we're gonna chill 
down our glass you can keep this in the freezer

or in the fridge but if there's no room you can 
just add some ice into the glass while you do

other things so that'll help a little bit set that 
aside and then we're gonna go in with our kaffir

lime infused vodka now this has been infusing for 
a week now and as you can see it's the color has

gone from bright green to a muted green which is 
completely normal if you like the flavor where it

is and you want to stay there you can remove the 
leaves perhaps leave one in there just so it's a

visual reminder of what's in the in the bottle 
it's kind of cute too so we're gonna go in with

that obviously the order of all this is really not 
important at all and then we're gonna go in with

our little chili vodka now I like to keep it in 
a little bottle because it's kind of like a hot

sauce for your cocktail so you can add as much 
or as little of this as you like I'm depending

on how spicy you want this you don't even have to 
add any of it if you don't want to and then we're

gonna go in with our mango juice now I know that 
I'm not giving you any amounts of any ingredients

for two reasons one you can make this as strong or 
as weak as you'd like I'm a little bit of a wuss

when it comes to hard liquor so I like mine more 
juicy than boozy but the ratio that's a good place

to start is one-to-one juice to liqueur taste 
it see how strong how weak you like it and then

adjust from there second reason why I'm not giving 
you proportions is because depends on how big your

glass is if cocktail glasses are all of different 
sizes my class for example holds about five ounces

so I'm gonna make sure that once everything is 
done I'm gonna have about five ounces so if your

glass is bigger you're gonna change accordingly 
so now we just have to shake I'm just gonna put

that ice in there and then use a slotted spoon 
so you don't add excessive water that's good

you can feel that heat but it's not it's not so 
much that it would be unpleasant but it's right

there at first and you're kind of confusing 
the heat with the heat of the alcohol but but

it lingers now if you want to turn this into 
something a little more rich and luxurious

there is a twist let's start over now for 
our twist I've decided to call it the hot

tie Coco and we're basically going to add a 
little bit of coconut milk into it and make

it a little richer and creamier so start out 
exactly the same as we did before and in with

the coconut milk I'm just going in about half 
an ounce or so not too much because you don't

want it to be thick you know you still want it to 
be refreshing you just want to add some richness

and some you know some coconut flavor and it's 
perfect for winter and we're doing this again

and now a great garnish for this just to float 
a little chilly it's a great way to let people

know that this drink is spicy without adding any 
extra spice to it and that's it that is our hot

Thai cocoa now for the full written recipe you 
can visit hot eye-catching calm if you like the

show please click to subscribe and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious timing
